ProductOverview.Summary: GeoPrism provides hierarchy and ontology management for normalizing disparate datasets  by common geographies and ontological terms, integration with DHIS2, and spatial dashboarding capabilities.
ProductOverview.Description: GeoPrism Registry (GPR) enables interoperability by location through the simultaneous hosting, management, regular updating, and sharing of master lists, associated hierarchies, and geospatial data for the geographic objects essential to sustainable development, including public health, education, agriculture, infrastructure, extreme weather, and other public and private services. GPR can also integrate data from digital public goods and NSDIs, such as public health and climate, to enhance geospatial awareness in large language models.
ProductOverview.Users: Country ministries of health, district health managers, local epidemiologists, meteorologists, entomologists, national management agencies, local management agencies, public communication channels

Reach.SummaryOfReach: GeoPrism Registry has been deployed in Laos, Mozambique, and for the US Federal Government.

ClimateAndHealthIntegration.Description: By managing the single source of truth for geo-objects (e.g., locations, features, org-units), hierarchies, and networks of geo-objects according to spatial and non-spatial semantic properties, GeoPrism Registry facilitates the integration of data across digital public goods and spatial data infrastructures. Additionally, it can sustainably bring geo-awareness from such sources into large language models.

Community.DescriptionOfCommunity: GeoPrism Registry is built and stewarded by a community of professional organizations and in-country teams. The main contributing organizations include TerraFrame, the Clinton Health Access Initiative, and the Health GeoLab Collaborative.

Events.description:
TerraFrame actively participates in the Architecture and Facility Registry working groups within the OpenHIE community and has presented at various sessions and conferences. OpenHIE has offered valuable feedback regarding the needs of components in the OpenHIE architecture for interoperability using common geographies.
TerraFrame is actively involved with the Open Geospatial Consortium and contributes to interoperability standards for extreme weather and disaster resilience.
TerraFame participates in the HL7 Patient Administration working group and has contributed to the FHIR Location resource specification for version 6. The specification aims to enable automated interoperability by location between health data and external datasets from national spatial data infrastructures.
Events.schedule:
The GeoPrism Registry Partners call is managed by the Clinton Health Access Initiative (CHAI) and meets roughly once a month.
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IhdtP275yseqUHELGqtHxLOZ6FpdpGmOS-K3pDth3dw/edit#heading=h.32w5fk7e92uf

Policies.Description: Committed to open source principles and responsible data governance.

Sustainability.Description: Although initially funded through grants, the development and maintenance of the GeoPrism Registry is funded through consulting projects with U.S. government agencies.
